wikipedia_page.main: Captain Adrian James Boswell Tonks  (10 May 1898 – 14 July 1919) was a British First World War flying ace. He was officially credited with twelve aerial victories, and was twice awarded the Distinguished Flying Cross.

response: * Adrian Tonks – flying ace of Naval 4, winner of two Distinguished Flying Crosses
